definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: He dashed into the inner office. He charged upon the desk of the stenographer.
sentences.chinese: 他箭步冲进里间办公室，向速记员的办公桌冲过去。

sentences.english: The young lady had been Maxwell's stenographer for a year.
sentences.chinese: 年轻女郎给马克斯韦尔当速记员已经有一年。

sentences.english: She was elected a steno grapher of that meeting.
sentences.chinese: 她被选为那次会议的速记员。

sentences.english: Thee young lady had been Maxwell's stenographer for a year.
sentences.chinese: 那位年轻姑娘给麦克斯韦尔当速记员已经有一年了。

sentences.english: Now he just needed a stenographer to help make sense of it all.
sentences.chinese: 现在他只需要一个速记员帮忙把这一切理清。

sentences.english: A stenograph er writes in shorthand.
sentences.chinese: 速记员是用速记符号书写的。

sentences.english: The young lady had been Maxwell’s stenographer for a year.
sentences.chinese: 那位年轻姑娘给麦克斯韦尔当速记员已经有一年了。

sentences.english: The court stenographer registered the trial proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 法院速记员做了审判记录。

sentences.english: The account of the trial was transcribed from the stenographer 's shorthand notes.
sentences.chinese: 这篇审判的报道是从速记员的笔记中抄录而来的。

sentences.english: Good afternoon, we would like to contract two stenographers for the coming week.
sentences.chinese: 午安，下周我们约订两名速记员。

definition: simultaneous interpretation (abbr. for 同聲傳譯|同声传译[tong2 sheng1 chuan2 yi4])
